title: The Russian Invasion Must Not Halt Ukraine's High-Tech Ambitions
description: Ukraine must look to sustaining its scientific base and information technology sector to ensure its future security and economic prosperity. The West can help by training its talent and providing resources to rebuild its science and technology infrastructure.

title: Parsing Fact and Fiction in the Maduro Regime’s Narrative of Economic Recovery
description: CSIS Americas senior fellow Ryan C. Berg unpacks how the Maduro regime's selective economic liberalization enriches regime loyalists while leaving ordinary Venezuelans behind.

title: Russia’s War in Ukraine: Identity, History, and Conflict
description: This paper explains the erroneous assumptions Kremlin made about Ukrainian identity that informed its decisionmaking and laid the foundations for its war against Ukraine.

title: War amid a Pandemic: The Public Health Consequences of Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine
description: As a renewed Russian assault on Ukraine’s southeast begins, Ukrainians are likely to face persistent and intensifying public health challenges as a direct result of the conflict.

title: Breaking Down the Arguments for and against U.S. Antitrust Legislation
description: Several major bills are currently pending in the 117th Congress to prevent anticompetitive practices by dominant technology platforms. This white paper provides an overview of the topics and debates surrounding the proposed legislation.

title: Japan’s Crucial Role in Southeast Asia amid the Ukraine War
description: As Southeast Asia takes different positions on the war in Ukraine, the role of influential actors is critical. And Japan—both capable and willing to bridge the growing fissure—is increasingly taking on that role.

title: The Evening: More Aid to Ukraine, Fed to Raise Rates, I Shall Be Released, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers More Aid to Ukraine, Fed to Raise Rates, I Shall Be Released, and More.

title: Ending the AIDS Epidemic: Are We Doing Enough to Reach Underserved Populations?
description: With the United States off track to reach the Ending the HIV Epidemic (EHE) targets, there needs to be a reevaluation of how HIV services are provided to at-risk populations and a reprioritization of the needs of underserved communities.

title: What Are the Trade Contours of the European Union’s Anti-coercion Instrument?
description: The CSIS Scholl Chair in International Business evaluates the European Union’s anti-coercion instrument, including specific provisions of the proposal and how it compares to the existing U.S. toolbox of trade remedies.

title: Five Years Later, French Face Same Contest but Different Odds
description: The 2022 French presidential election is a rematch of the Macron-Le Pen contest of 2017, but the political situation has changed and so have the odds for the incumbent president.

title: Navigating Emerging Technology and Evolving Threats in the U.S.-Australia Alliance
description: At a time when regional states see growing instability and are concerned about their place in an increasingly tense region, the U.S.-Australia alliance has an opportunity to lead by example.

title: The Evening: Russia Tests ICBM, Sanctions Crackdown, C’est La Vie, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Russia Tests ICBM, Sanctions Crackdown, C’est La Vie, and More.
